Imagine black lotus in a word with 0 card draw and 0 tutors. This becomes a giant 2 for 1 engine. I always get excited when someone drops a black lotus in MTG tactics, thinking 2 for 1.  
  
And I rate on balance, the Power 9 were impossible to beat unless u had the power 9. Kinda destroyed the point of this complex card game that had all these creatures and whatnot.  
  
.5/5

Posted By: TheWrathofShane (9/4/2012 8:52:10 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: All of you guys talking abot black lotus as dark ritual and coming up with these goofy combos are missing the (previously) obvious one that a lot of people used 14 years ago to repeatedly demolish opponents. Granted, the proper hand doesn't come up all that often as this card was restricted even back then, but the combo is a simple one: [black lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=black lotus), mountain, [channel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=channel), [fireball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=fireball)/[disintigrate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=disintigrate). The lotus dumps for 3 green, cast channel - pop the fireball with the mountain and pump in your remaining 1 green from the lotus + 19 life from channel and the other sucker doesn't even get a chance to play. Channel and Lotus were both restricted even back then, so the combo didn't come up on the first turn too often, but it was still an instant kill when it did so a lot of people used it.
posts.html:
All of you guys talking abot black lotus as dark ritual and coming up with these goofy combos are missing the (previously) obvious one that a lot of people used 14 years ago to repeatedly demolish opponents. Granted, the proper hand doesn't come up all that often as this card was restricted even back then, but the combo is a simple one: black lotus, mountain, channel, fireball/disintigrate. The lotus dumps for 3 green, cast channel - pop the fireball with the mountain and pump in your remaining 1 green from the lotus + 19 life from channel and the other sucker doesn't even get a chance to play. Channel and Lotus were both restricted even back then, so the combo didn't come up on the first turn too often, but it was still an instant kill when it did so a lot of people used it.

posts.post_content:
The authentic masterpiece. [Accept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=48189) [no](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=114904) [imitations](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=4593). :)  
  
In one of my first games of Magic with my partner (on an early date), I demonstrated the Black Lotus + Fastbond + Taiga + Fireball kill. I've had two tournament-playable Lotuses since forever; my partner gave me a third for our one-year-dating anniversary (the awesomely gigantic oversized cardboard one) -- along with a Fastbond print which she found goodness knows where -- and along with a note that read, "A single spark of passion can ignite love's lasting flame -- you had me at turn one." Easily the best awwwww moment of my life. Better even than any engagement ring I could have received (though I want my wedding ring to resemble that awesome-looking new [Sol Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=247533) they just printed for EDH/Commander). In fact, we'll be printing the first part on our wedding invitatio... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Really, why do people care about this dying to [Shatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shatter)? It even dies to [Crush](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crush)! :D :D :D  
  
By the way, for anyone still not understanding: If you play it on your first turn, your opponent won't have mana for playing an artifact removal. And, more important, you usually play and then immediately sacrifice this one, so your opponent can't cast anything between resolving and sacrificing...

posts.post_content: People that find a fault with the playability of this card don't have a full grasp of the game. Even if you don't draw it until mid-game it's a big mana boost. When you DO draw it in your first hand it can't kill your opponent by itself, but it is THE KEY to many first turn kills. When judging this card put it in the context in which it was created. Look at the Alpha, Beta, or Unlimited lists and see the limited # of cards that actually existed then. Magic is really just a death race and this baby is the king of speed.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
People are either rating this 5 Stars for sheer broken power, or they're rating it much lower for 'badly Designed- ergo not fun- ergo not "good" as I define good which includes more than win-probability increase power"  
  
Actually, after looking a lot at Vintage lists, there are some cards that I would expect to see WAY more often in decklists, and yet don't have the ubiquity their reputation suggests they should. Black Lotus is just such one of these cards, and while it's \*potential\* is simply screamingly powerful, it \*looks\* like the Vintage players of today don't just slam it in lists because they own it- Oh they DO run it, a lot, but also, I've seen WINNING decklists for Vintage that use mana and do not use Black Lotus- why not then?  
  
[Chalice of the Void](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chalice of the Void) is an Anti-0 cost Hate Tech in Vintage. I don't think it's the explanation, but I mention that card more as a question than a statement- do that, Null Rod and other hate really account for anything less than 100%... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Q: What's the difference between a Black Lotus and a pile of dead babies?  
A: I don't own a Black Lotus.  
  
Q: What's the difference between a Black Lotus and a black man?  
A: When you tap a Black Lotus, you get three mana. When you tap a black man, you get shot.  
  
Q: What's the difference between Black Lotuses and fat women?  
A: I'd rather f-uck a Black Lotus.  
  
Q: What does a black scientist and a Black Lotus have in common?  
A: They are both very rare.
